meanings.definition: A continuous, high-pitched sound made by a group of birds.
meanings.sent1: The chirm of the birds filled the forest with music.
meanings.sent2: I heard the chirm of sparrows outside my window every morning.
meanings.sent3: The chirm of the birds woke me up, sounding like a natural alarm clock.
meanings.sent4: The chirm of the birds was a symphony of nature's own making.
meanings.sent5: The chirm of the birds was a delightful melody in the air.

meanings.definition: To make a series of high-pitched sounds, as birds do.
meanings.sent1: The birds chirmed happily in the trees.
meanings.sent2: I love to hear the birds chirming on a sunny day.
meanings.sent3: The birds seemed to chirm a greeting as I walked by.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter chirmed through the room like a bird's song.
meanings.sent5: The wind chirmed softly through the leaves, mimicking the birds.

meanings.definition: A group of birds making a series of high-pitched sounds.
meanings.sent1: The chirm of sparrows in the park was a joyful cacophony.
meanings.sent2: A chirm of finches fluttered around the feeder.
meanings.sent3: The chirm of seagulls by the beach was both soothing and lively.
meanings.sent4: The chirm of the birds overhead was like a moving cloud of music.
meanings.sent5: The chirm of the birds signaled the arrival of spring in the valley.
